UI_visible_response: Read 21 web pagesView Page DetailsThe exact number of people who died during the Long March is not definitively known, but there are several estimates:Battle of Xiangjiang River: More than 50,000 of the Red Army's 86,000 troops died in this battle alone.Overall Estimates:Approximately 90,000 men and women died during the Long March.Of the 86,000 people who set off, only around 8,000 to 9,000 survived. traffic_visible_response: The exact number of people who died during the Long March is not definitively known, but there are several estimates:- **Battle of Xiangjiang River**: More than 50,000 of the Red Army's 86,000 troops died in this battle alone[^4^].- **Overall Estimates**:     - Approximately 90,000 men and women died during the Long March[^8^].    - Of the 86,000 people who set off, only around 8,000 to 9,000 survived[^6^][^10^]. This implies that nearly 90% of the marchers perished due to various causes such as starvation, illness, exhaustion, and combat-related deaths[^6^].
